poem:
### In the Shadow of Power

Iron birds weave  
through the air,  
their mechanical song  
unheard over fields  
once green, now  
tremulous with fear.  
A spark here,  
a fire there  
where man's creation  
trembles,  
caught in its own  
labyrinthine dance.  
History whispers,  
while time—  
both culprit  
and victim—  
falls like ash,  
indifferent.
